msItem.p: Paper manuscript; Yavanajātaka, astrology and calendrical computation (fragment).

support.p: Paper manuscript. Incomplete. Originally 81 folios (ff. 8–87, 90), but only one folio is currently available for study.

condition.p: Some folios missing and damaged, but the extant folio is generally well preserved and highly legible.

handNote.p: Written in New Newarī script (Northern Nāgarī), regular hand, brown ink. Orthography suggests an eighteenth-century date.

origin.p: Probably eighteenth century, based on orthographic features and the red alignment lines used for ruling.

facsimile.desc: Digital color photograph of folio Q90r from the paper manuscript Yavanajātaka (NGMPP A 1122/3 = NAK 6/2397), written in New Newarī (Northern Nāgarī) script. The image reproduces one folio of an eighteenth-century Nepalese copy, photographed in 2011 for the Nepal-German Manuscript Preservation Project (NGMPP).

surface.desc: Courtesy of Professor Michio Yano (Kyoto Sangyo University) and the NGMPP. © National Archives of Nepal / Nepal-German Manuscript Preservation Project, 2011.

sourceDesc.p: NGMPP A 1122/3 = NAK 6/2397 (originally labelled as Bṛhadyavanajātaka). Paper manuscript, 81 folios (ff. 8–87, 90), 41.6 × 13.2 cm, 11 lines per page. Eighteenth century (based on orthography and red alignment lines). Digitized color photographs produced in 2011 by Michio Yano for the NGMPP, with facilitation by Harunaga Isaacson and Albrecht Hanisch.

div.head: Transcription (Devanāgarī)
div.ab:
षेन यात्यङ् गुरुदर्शने
त्रितङ्ग्र त्रिभिर् एव च्ोद्यं ||८७||

शते ऽष्टकोग्राधशता धिके द्वे गत्वाष्टवर्गेन शतद्वयेन । वक्रे ऽष्टशट्कोण चतुर्गुणा षड्
गत्वा दिना तिष्ठति
ः ||८८||

div.head: Transcription (Romanized)
div.ab:
ṣena yātyaṅ gurudarśane
tritaṅgra tribhir eva codyam ||87||

śate 'ṣṭakogrādhaśatā dhike dve gatvāṣṭavargena śatadvayena | vakre 'ṣṭaśaṭkoṇa caturguṇā ṣaḍ
gatvā dinā tiṣṭhati
ḥ ||88||

div.head: Edited Text (Romanized)
div.ab: śeṣeṇa prācyāparadarśane tu jñena tritaṅka tribhir eva vādyam ||45||
śate 'ṣṭakāgre 'rdhaśatādhike dve gatvāṣṭavargeṇa śatadvayena | vakre 'ṣṭaṣaṭkeṇa caturguṇaṃ ṣaḍ gatvā dinān tiṣṭhati pañca śukraḥ ||46||

div.head: Translation
div.ab: Furthermore, there are two first visibilities (darśana) - one in the East and one in the West; therefore...
Venus goes 258° in 208 (tithis); then it goes in vakra 24° in 48 tithis, and stands still for five days (= tithis);
